title: Mathematics Pedagogy Workshop Utilizing Flipped Learning and Video Reflection

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic mathematical concepts and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: VR-based flipped learning model and video reflection tools for secondary mathematics teacher training and pre-service teachers in simulated environments

learning_goals: In a flipped learning environment, learners complete over 90% of pre-learning materials (videos, readings) and achieve an 80%+ quiz pass rate.
Learners solve three types of complex mathematical problems through collaborative problem-solving activities with peers in VR simulations.
Learners analyze their learning processes via weekly video reflections and submit improvement plans at least four times.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
